# LAError.Code

**Enumeration**

Errors issued by the LocalAuthentication framework.

## Declaration

```swift
enum Code
```

## Cancellation

- **LAError.Code.appCancel**: The app canceled authentication.
- **LAError.Code.systemCancel**: The system canceled authentication.
- **LAError.Code.userCancel**: The user tapped the cancel button in the authentication dialog.

## Biometry failure

- **LAError.Code.biometryDisconnected**: The device supports biometry only using a removable accessory, but the paired accessory isn’t connected.
- **biometryLockout**: Biometry is locked because there were too many failed attempts.
- **biometryNotAvailable**: Biometry is not available on the device.
- **biometryNotEnrolled**: The user has no enrolled biometric identities.
- **LAError.Code.biometryNotPaired**: The device supports biometry only using a removable accessory, but no accessory is paired.
- **LAError.Code.touchIDLockout**: Touch ID is locked because there were too many failed attempts.
- **LAError.Code.touchIDNotAvailable**: Touch ID is not available on the device.
- **LAError.Code.touchIDNotEnrolled**: The user has no enrolled Touch ID fingers.

## Other errors

- **LAError.Code.authenticationFailed**: The user failed to provide valid credentials.
- **LAError.Code.invalidContext**: The context was previously invalidated.
- **LAError.Code.invalidDimensions**
- **LAError.Code.notInteractive**: Displaying the required authentication user interface is forbidden.
- **LAError.Code.passcodeNotSet**: A passcode isn’t set on the device.
- **LAError.Code.userFallback**: The user tapped the fallback button in the authentication dialog, but no fallback is available for the authentication policy.
- **LAError.Code.watchNotAvailable**: An attempt to authenticate with Apple Watch failed.

## Supporting Constants

- **kLAErrorDomain**: The error domain used by LocalAuthentication.
- **kLAErrorAppCancel**: The app canceled authentication.
- **kLAErrorSystemCancel**: The system canceled authentication.
- **kLAErrorUserCancel**: The user tapped the cancel button in the authentication dialog.
- **kLAErrorBiometryDisconnected**: The device supports biometry only using a removable accessory, but the paired accessory isn’t connected.
- **kLAErrorBiometryLockout**: Biometry is locked because there were too many failed attempts.
- **kLAErrorBiometryNotAvailable**: Biometry is not available on the device.
- **kLAErrorBiometryNotEnrolled**: The user has no enrolled biometric identities.
- **kLAErrorBiometryNotPaired**: The device supports biometry only using a removable accessory, but no accessory is paired.
- **kLAErrorTouchIDLockout**: Touch ID is locked because there were too many failed attempts.
- **kLAErrorTouchIDNotAvailable**: Touch ID is not available on the device.
- **kLAErrorTouchIDNotEnrolled**: The user has no enrolled Touch ID fingers.
- **kLAErrorAuthenticationFailed**: The user failed to provide valid credentials.
- **kLAErrorInvalidContext**: The context was previously invalidated.
- **kLAErrorInvalidDimensions**
- **kLAErrorNotInteractive**: Displaying the required authentication user interface is forbidden.
- **kLAErrorPasscodeNotSet**: A passcode isn’t set on the device.
- **kLAErrorUserFallback**: The user tapped the fallback button in the authentication dialog, but no fallback is available for the authentication policy.
- **kLAErrorWatchNotAvailable**: An attempt to authenticate with Apple Watch failed.

## Enumeration Cases

- **LAError.Code.companionNotAvailable**: Authentication could not start because there was no paired companion device nearby.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Type Properties

- **companionNotAvailable**

## Errors

- **LAError**: Errors issued by the LocalAuthentication framework.
- **LAErrorDomain**: The error domain that the framework uses when issuing errors.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
